attributes.action: Make the ambulance service an emergency service
attributes.additional_details:
The ambulance service is contacted via 999.
Just like the police and fire service.
Yet the ambulance service is classed as an essential service NOT an emergency one.
The crews save lives in all types of conditions. They work 12-hour shifts many times without a break.
They earn far less than their counterparts in the police and fire service yet they probably help deal with the same situations.
They have to work until they are 66 to get a pension . Fire or police personnel get theirs years earlier

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because we aren't sure what action you would like the UK Government or Parliament to take.

There aren't classifications of "essential" or "emergency" services which decide how a service is funded or staff's terms and conditions of service.

You could start a new petition asking the Government to allow ambulance service staff to retire at the same age as police or fire crews if that is something you would like to see happen.
